citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Multiple birds from two walk-in aviaries are unaccounted for since the last inspection of 13 November 2024, which include
2 Anna’s Hummingbirds, 1 Hermit Thrush, and 1 Western Tanager. A keeper record dated 01 February 2025 notes that
the Hermit Thrush and Western Tanager have not been seen for the whole of January and that the female Anna’s
Hummingbird has not been seen for 2 months. The birds have not been recovered and a facility representative concludes
the birds may have died in the aviaries. One aviary houses hummingbirds only and the other is a mixed species exhibit
housing approximately 90 birds. Both aviaries are outdoor enclosures with double door entries.
Failure to conduct daily observations of birds does not allow for accountability of birds in the collection, potential changes
in health status or injury, which may lead to death. Daily observation of all animals must be performed to assess their
health and well-being. There shall be a mechanism of direct and frequent communication on problems of animal health,
behavior and well-being to the attending veterinarian.
Correct from this date forward of 14 February 2025.

No disposition records exist for 2 Northern Bobwhites and 1 Gambel’s Quail. No acquisition records exist for juvenile
Hooded Orioles in an unknown number. The inventory provided indicates 2 Northern Bobwhites and 1 Gambel’s Quail
have died since 27 August 2024, but no date or method of death is stated. The inventory provided stated there are 5
Hooded Orioles and no births since 27 August 2024. The Hooded Orioles only live in the large walk-in aviary at the facility
and there appeared to be more than 5 birds of this species in the aviary during inspection. Many appeared to be juvenile
and fully flighted. The facility representative indicated that the aviary birds are allowed to breed freely and there are likely
more than 5 Hooded Orioles present.
Records containing the required information for animals disposed of or acquired for use in regulated activities, including
those offspring born on premises, are necessary to accurately track animals to ensure their humane care and use. The
licensee shall make, keep and maintain records of acquisition and disposition of all animals that fully and correctly
disclose the required information in this subpart.
Correct by 17 February 2025.

The outdoor enclosure for the singly housed Black-crowned Night Heron has heavy orange-red rust over the entire interior
of the mesh metal roof. Excessive rust can compromise structural strength, create rough and jagged surfaces that could
injure the birds, and prevent proper cleaning and sanitization. Any surfaces that come in contact with the birds must be
free of rust or damage that affects the structural integrity of the surface or prevents cleaning.
Correct by 16 March 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Critical
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Multiple birds from two walk-in aviaries are unaccounted for since the last inspection of 13 November 2024, which include 
2 Anna’s Hummingbirds, 1 Hermit Thrush, and 1 Western Tanager. A keeper record dated 01 February 2025 notes that 
the Hermit Thrush and Western Tanager have not been seen for the whole of January and that the female Anna’s 
Hummingbird has not been seen for 2 months. The birds have not been recovered and a facility representative concludes 
the birds may have died in the aviaries. One aviary houses hummingbirds only and the other is a mixed species exhibit 
housing approximately 90 birds. Both aviaries are outdoor enclosures with double door entries.  
 
Failure to conduct daily observations of birds does not allow for accountability of birds in the collection, potential changes 
in health status or injury, which may lead to death. Daily observation of all animals must be performed to assess their 
health and well-being. There shall be a mechanism of direct and frequent communication on problems of animal health, 
behavior and well-being to the attending veterinarian. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 14 February 2025. 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
No disposition records exist for 2 Northern Bobwhites and 1 Gambel’s Quail. No acquisition records exist for juvenile 
Hooded Orioles in an unknown number. The inventory provided indicates 2 Northern Bobwhites and 1 Gambel’s Quail 
have died since 27 August 2024, but no date or method of death is stated. The inventory provided stated there are 5 
Hooded Orioles and no births since 27 August 2024. The Hooded Orioles only live in the large walk-in aviary at the facility 
and there appeared to be more than 5 birds of this species in the aviary during inspection. Many appeared to be juvenile 
and fully flighted. The facility representative indicated that the aviary birds are allowed to breed freely and there are likely 
more than 5 Hooded Orioles present.  
 
Records containing the required information for animals disposed of or acquired for use in regulated activities, including 
those offspring born on premises, are necessary to accurately track animals to ensure their humane care and use. The 
licensee shall make, keep and maintain records of acquisition and disposition of all animals that fully and correctly

disclose the required information in this subpart. 
 
Correct by 17 February 2025. 
3.150(c)(2) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The outdoor enclosure for the singly housed Black-crowned Night Heron has heavy orange-red rust over the entire interior 
of the mesh metal roof. Excessive rust can compromise structural strength, create rough and jagged surfaces that could 
injure the birds, and prevent proper cleaning and sanitization. Any surfaces that come in contact with the birds must be 
free of rust or damage that affects the structural integrity of the surface or prevents cleaning. 
 
Correct by 16 March 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
